title: Leeds United owner confirms discussions with three parties looking to invest in club
text:
Leeds United owner Andrea Radrizzani has confirmed he is in discussions with three interested parties willing to invest in the Championship club.

Radrizzani has made no secret of his desire to bring in extra money as he looks to return the Yorkshire club – which is currently sitting fifth in the Championship – to the Premier League and claims one of the groups would potentially give them the sort of economic power wielded by Manchester City.

It remains to be seen how the Qatar Sports Investment Group would be able to flex that sort of muscle in the Championship, given the restrictions imposed by Financial Fair Play Regulations, but Radrizzani looks certain to bring in a new partner in the next few weeks.

“I have been approached by more than 20 parties and I have selected these three,” Radrizzani told The Times.

“The option of Qatar Sports Investment and Nasser [al-Khelaifi] – first of all they are friends, we have had a good relationship for a long time. Secondly, they have the possibility to bring this club to compete with Manchester City, so for the fans that could be a fantastic opportunity.
description: Leeds United owner Andrea Radrizzani has confirmed he is in discussions with three interested parties willing to invest in the Championship club.
